===Etymology===
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=とりこ|取り|tr1=tori|t1=taking, capturing|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|取る}} ''toru'', “to take, to capture”|子|tr2=ko|t2=child; small thing}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|とりこ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|虜}}, {{ja-l|俘}}, {{ja-l|囚}}, {{ja-l|俘虜}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|とりこ}}

# [[prisoner]], [[captive]], [[slave]]

====Usage notes====
Also used [[metaphor]]ically, such as {{m|ja|恋}}{{m|ja|の}}{{m|ja|擒|tr=koi no toriko|lit=love's slave}}.
